author: daneofurexistence

text:
Oh dear, I had no idea you hadn't uploaded this one yet, ahaha.
The first time I'd ever heard it was from a PC beat game called Osu. It was a hard song to play, but it's a fun song to play.
The game itself is really weird from what I've seen, and what a great song to start into that game with.

text: While I like this game, it's always bothered me that the rules of what size objects you can and can't pick up with the Katamari aren't entirely consistent.  Can't deny dat soundtrack though.

text: I really need to listen to more music from this series.  It has a very unique style in terms of the music it does.
author: Eric C.

text: Wow. I'm surprised this wasn't on the list before! I've always wanted to play this. It looks like one hell of a fun game. The music's certainly nice.
author: Retrauk

text: @Retrauk I've been holding out on this one for a long time, for no specific reason. Well actually, I do like to spread the most popular themes from their respective games around in the list to keep it varied and surprising!
author: SupraDarky

text: it is the most fun a game can ever be!!! It's very satisfying, it can be challenging when it wants to be, it's constantly hilarious, and the soundtrack is one of the best ever!!!
author: Draculaface

text: Growing up this was one of my favorite games.  Sooo addiciting, the newer one's aren't as good unfortunately.  What made the series good was that you start small and then pick up bigger things as you go but the new one's randomized the size making it not so rewarding to play.
author: Soshi Nine

text: My thoughts exactly! And it is every bit as fun as it looks. Play it next time you get the opportunity. :D
author: Pulsar

text:
+Soshi Nine My issue with these newer ones is the gimicky levels. (I'm looking at you, "make a bonfire" stage). I just want to roll stuff up until I'm bigger. Until I can hear screams. Until I can capture gods.

Looking back though, I never liked the gimicked levels in the 1st Katamary (capture a Bear or Cow level). The games are fun anyway...as long as I'm not on those levels.
author: dannywolfpero

text: Literally playing this right now, the Katamari wavelengths are in the air guys
author: Josiah Wolf

text: The perfect main theme for such a weird game. Very catchy, the "Naaa nananana Katamari Damacy" never left my head since I first heard it 10 years ago. I feel like playing this game right now.
author: SupraDarky

text: Perfect timing! This is a cult classic game that all gamers have come to know. I like how you repp'ed all the other classics from this series before this one. A friend of mine and I bonded one lazy afternoon in college over this game. A never forget :3
